About

I am a research assistant at the Yale School of Management, based in New Haven, CT. I double-majored in mathematics and economics at the University of Utah and I have a Master's degree in economics from Columbia University in New York. I am an aspiring researcher and intend to pursue a PhD in economics. I am specially interested in public and development economics.

Publications

The effects on insurance costs of restricting undocumented immigrants' access to driver licenses 2015-02-26

Published by Southern Economic Journal

This paper uses panel data on US states to examine the impact of imposing documented presence and social security number requirements to obtain a driver's license.
